Journal.Title: Clinical infectious diseases : an official publication of the Infectious Diseases Society of America

Article.ArticleTitle: Severity, criticality, and fatality of the SARS-CoV-2 Beta variant.

Abstract.AbstractText: Beta (B.1.351) variant COVID-19 disease was investigated in Qatar. Compared to Alpha (B.1.1.7) variant, odds of progressing to severe disease were 1.24-fold (95% CI: 1.11-1.39) higher for Beta. Odds of progressing to critical disease were 1.49-fold (95% CI: 1.13-1.97) higher. Odds of COVID-19 death were 1.57-fold (95% CI: 1.03-2.43) higher.
